description: Whether to enable generate openssh host keys for the initrd. This must be enabled before they can be configured.

name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.generateHostKeys

name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.regenerateWeakRSAHostKey

name: nix.deleteUserProfiles

description: Whether to system closure diffing on updates.
name: nix.diffSystem

description: Whether to set recommend and secure default settings.

description: Whether to set recommended default settings.
name: programs.tmux.recommendedDefaults

description: If set to true, use Let's Encrypt's staging environment instead of the production one. The staging environment has much higher rate limits but does not generate fully signed certificates. This is great for testing when the normla rate limit is hit fast and impacts other people on the same IP. See https://letsencrypt.org/docs/staging-environment for more detail.
name: security.acme.staging

description: LDAP options used in other services.
name: security.ldap

description: The DN of the service user used by services. The user base dn will be automatically appended.
name: security.ldap.bindDN

description:
Domain component(s) (dc) represented as a list of strings.

Each entry will be prefixed with dc= and all are concatinated with ,, except the last one. The example would be concatinated to dc=example,dc=com
name: security.ldap.domainComponent

description: The domain name to connect to the ldap server's ldaps port.
name: security.ldap.domainName

description: The attribute of the user object where to find its given name.
name: security.ldap.givenNameField

description: A function that returns a group filter that matches the first argument against the names of the groups the user is part of.
example: group: "(&(objectclass=person)(isMemberOf=cn=${group},${config.security.ldap.roleBaseDN}"
type: function that evaluates to a(n) string
name: security.ldap.groupFilter

description: The attribute of the user object where to find its email.
name: security.ldap.mailField

description: The port the ldap server listens on. Usually this is 389 for ldap and 636 for ldaps.
type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)
name: security.ldap.port

description: The directory path where applications should search for users. Domain component will be automatically appended.
name: security.ldap.roleBaseDN

description: The attribute where the user account is listed in a group.
name: security.ldap.roleField

description: Filter to get the groups of an user object.
name: security.ldap.roleFilter

description: The attribute of the user object where to find its distinguished name.
name: security.ldap.roleValue

description: A function that returns a search filter that may include a group filter. The first argument may be the group that is filtered upon or null. If set to null no additional filtering is done. If set the supplied filter is combined with the user filter. The second argument must be the user filter including the applications placeholders or ideally the userFilter option.
example: userFilterGroup: userFilter: if (userFilterGroup != null) then "(&${config.security.ldap.groupFilter userFilterGroup})" else userFilter
type: function that evaluates to a(n) function that evaluates to a(n) string
name: security.ldap.searchFilterWithGroupFilter

description: The uid of the service user used by services, often referred as search user.
name: security.ldap.searchUID

description: The attribute of the user object where to find its ssh public key.
name: security.ldap.sshPublicKeyField

description: The attribute of the user object where to find its surname.
name: security.ldap.surnameField

description: The directory path where applications should search for users. Domain component will be automatically appended.
name: security.ldap.userBaseDN

description: The attribute of the user object where to find its username.
name: security.ldap.userField

description: A function that returns a user search filter that uses the first argument as the placeholder.
example: "param: \"(&(objectclass=person)(|(uid=\${param})(mail=\${param})))\""
type: function that evaluates to a(n) string
name: security.ldap.userFilter

description: The domain name to connect to, to visit the ldap server web interface and to which to issue cookies to.
name: security.ldap.webDomainName

    hash = "...";

]

Whether to enable login only via LDAP

      Only enable this after completing the onboarding!

.

description: Whether to enable login only via LDAP. The bind user password must be placed at /var/lib/hydra/ldap-password.conf in the format bindpw = "PASSWORD" It is recommended to use a password without special characters because the perl config parser has weird escaping rule like that comment characters#` must be escape with backslash .
name: services.hydra.ldap.enable

description: Map LDAP groups to hydra permissions. See upstream doc, especially role_mapping.
example:
[
  {
    hydra-admins = "admins";
  }
]
type: list of attribute set of string
name: services.hydra.ldap.roleMappings

description: Shared configuration snipped added to every virtualHosts' extraConfig.
name: services.nginx.commonServerConfig

description: Whether to enable quic support in nginx.
name: services.nginx.configureQuic

description: The acme host to use for the default 404 server.
name: services.nginx.default404Server.acmeHost

description: Wether to add a default server which always responds with 404. This is useful when using a wildcard cname with a wildcard certitificate to not return the first server entry in the config on unknown subdomains or to do the same for an old and not fully removed domain. The addresses to listen on are derived from services.nginx.defaultListenAddresses.
name: services.nginx.default404Server.enable

description: Whether to generate more secure, 2048 bits dhparams replacing the default 1024 bits.
name: services.nginx.generateDhparams

description: Whether to open the firewall port for the http (80/tcp), https (443/tcp) and if enabled quic (443/udp) ports.
name: services.nginx.openFirewall

description: Whether to set recommended performance options not grouped into other settings.
name: services.nginx.recommendedDefaults

description: Whether to set resolver address to environment.nameservers.
name: services.nginx.resolverAddrFromNameserver

description: Whether to keep logs only for 7 days and rotate them daily.
name: services.nginx.rotateLogsFaster

description: Whether to add the HSTS header to all virtual hosts.
name: services.nginx.setHSTSHeader

description: Whether to enable tcp fast open.
name: services.nginx.tcpFastOpen

description: This option has no description.
name: services.nginx.virtualHosts

description:
Shared configuration snipped added to every locations' extraConfig.

::: {.note} This option mainly exists because nginx' add_header and headers_more's more_set_headers function do not support inheritance to lower levels. :::
name: services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.commonLocationsConfig

description: This option has no description.
name: services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.locations

description: This option has no description.
name: services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.locations.<name>.extraConfig

description: Whether to fix host key permissions to prevent lock outs.
name: services.openssh.fixPermissions

description: Whether to set recommend and secure default settings.
name: services.openssh.recommendedDefaults

description: Whether to regenerate weak (less than 4096 bits) RSA host keys..
name: services.openssh.regenerateWeakRSAHostKey

description: Whether to add a hosts entry for the portunus domain pointing to externalIp
name: services.portunus.addToHosts

description:
Wether to configure OAuth2 Proxy with Portunus' Dex.

Use services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.virtualHosts to configure the nginx virtual hosts that should require authentication.

To properly function this requires the services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.domain option from https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/273234.
name: services.portunus.configureOAuth2Proxy

description: This option has no description.
name: services.portunus.domain

description: Internal IPv4 of portunus instance. This is used in the addToHosts option.
name: services.portunus.internalIp4

description: Internal IPv6 of portunus instance. This is used in the addToHosts option.
name: services.portunus.internalIp6

description: Whether to set config.security.ldap to portunus specific settings.
name: services.portunus.ldapPreset

description: When enabled, remove the function to add new Groups via the web ui, to enforce seeding usage.
name: services.portunus.removeAddGroup

name: services.portunus.seedGroups

description: Whether to configure and enable pg_stat_statements.

description:
List of all databases.

This option is used eg. when intalling extensions like pg_stat_stements in all databases.

::: {.note} services.postgresql.ensureDatabases and postgres are automatically added. :::
name: services.postgresql.databases

description: Whether to set recommended default settings.
name: services.postgresql.recommendedDefaults

description: Whether to install the upgrade-pg-cluster script to update postgres.
name: services.postgresql.upgrade.enable

description: Extra arguments to pass to pg_upgrade. See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/pgupgrade.html for doc.
name: services.postgresql.upgrade.extraArgs

description: The postgres package to which should be updated. After running upgrade-pg-cluster this must be set to services.postgresql.package to complete the update.
name: services.postgresql.upgrade.newPackage

description: Systemd services to stop when upgrade is started.
example:
[
  "hedgedoc"
  "hydra"
  "nginx"
]
name: services.postgresql.upgrade.stopServices

name: simd.arch

description: Whether to enable optimized builds with simd instructions.
name: simd.enable

description: Whether to disable some usual rarely used things to slim down the system.
name: slim.enable

name: virtualisation.docker.aggresiveAutoPrune

description: Whether to set recommended and maintenance reducing default settings.
